text: Scatter them into the sea
Look a little closer
Much of your pain is self chosen
With a richer heart and lips more yielding to the spirit will I speak
Life goes not backward nor tarries with yesterday
Suspended like scales between your sorrow and your joy
One day you will find the right words, and they will be simple.
Keep a little fire burning; however small, however hidden
Stand not in your own sunshine
In all of us there is an unaddressed urgency which we cannot really name
Ring the bells that still can ring
Where the fear has gone, there will be nothing
Dreams make good stories
The moment of revelation is a shock
Every act of rebellion expresses a nostalgia for innocence
This world is just paint on canvas
Dance through the panic until gathered safely in
We let our light shine, brilliant and unashamed
Many-throned, many-minded, many-wiled, daughter of Zeus
Ambition is a lust that is never quenched
Beauty and strength, leaping laughter and delicious languor, force and fire, are of us
You have loved the stars too fondly to be fearful of the night
Let us live so we do not regret years of inertia
A mirage that nevertheless looms large
It is not our part here to take thought only for a season
And here I have found what I sought not indeed, but finding I would possess for ever
For every moment of triumph, for every instance of beauty, many souls must be trampled
Strength is not created by adversity; it is merely awakened by it
The world is richer for those who dare to explore its depths
Ka was like a wheel, its one purpose to turn, and in the end it always came back to the place where it had started
Every man and every woman is a star. Pity not the fallen! I never knew them
Visit the interior parts of the earth: by rectification thou shalt find the hidden stone
Thou hast no right but to do thy will. Do that, and no other shall say nay. For pure will, unassuaged of purpose, delivered from the lust of result, is every way perfect.
Smooth and smiling faces everywhere, but ruin in their eyes
And, drunk with my own madness, I shouted at him furiously; Make life beautiful! Make life beautiful!
Joy is of the will which labours, which overcomes obstacles, which knows triumph
